_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.Facility Policy - The owners & management of Wymore Fertiizer/Krider are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepeared to work with the local fire dept and law enforcement to migigate any releases to the population and the environment of the community.

2. Facililty Information - Wymore Fertilizer/Krider part time employees are based at Wymore Fertilizer Office location and go to the premise as needed. The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilize product anhydrous ammonia received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production. Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designated for that purpose. The maximum amount of anhydrous ammonia stored at said facility is 140,000 lbs. During periods of non operation, of this facility, the owner will conduct inspections of this facility. Anything out of the ordinary is reported to local law enforcement and appropriate action is taken

3. Accidental Release Prevention Program - The facility has implemented the provisions of safety requirements for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia published by the American National Standards Institute and the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia.

4. Five Year Accident History - Wymore Fertilizer/Krider has leased said premise and has purchased the anhydrous ammonia equipment located on said premise. To the best of our knowledge, there have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at this facility, nor to our knowledge have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

5. Emergency Response Program - Our facility has contacted the local responders and we do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.

6. Planned Ch

anges to improve safety - Safety improvements will be an on going process at our facility. Periodic evaluations will be performed to assess our prevention and safety programs.
